urls.title: 'Shocking': Hazardous waste in fertiliser linked to catastrophic loss of dairy herd
urls.description: The Environment Agency has confirmed that it is investigating the loss of an entire dairy herd, which reports have linked to liquid fertiliser containing hazardous waste, including pharmaceuticals and petrochemicals.

urls.title: EXCLUSIVE: EA‚Äôs new river monitoring plans will ‚Äòdecimate‚Äô sampling network
urls.description: Environment Agency (EA) plans to overhaul its river quality monitoring regime by introducing a new system that monitors water quality at randomly selected sites have been branded a ‚Äúload of rubbish‚Äù by staff working at the regulator who fear that the strategy will ‚Äúdecimate‚Äù existing sampling capacity.

text: Very interesting Q&A in this month's @H2Oconservators  talk. The @EnvAgency is now so starved of funds that its sampling of inland water is in danger of not being statistically significant. Either we need to refund the EA or we should use remote monitors. https://t.co/FyUxQ3NJ83

Question - @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA
Why is the wrong health limit applied to Whalleys Quarry Landfill given that our community's health has been affected for many years. My son already has brain scaring & CP. The constant exposure to H2S is causing him headache & nose bleeds! https://t.co/Mo50j35VW5

2/2 @RedIndustries2 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @pow_rebecca only when our children and loved ones aren‚Äôt choking at night in noxious fumes only THEN will we back off. Just remember who you serve. Provide us with an END. until then  we aren‚Äôt going anywhere despite your words
